title: Super Sunday for India: Reactions to Krishna Nagar, Suhas Yathirajâ€™s medals at Tokyo Paralympics
content:
Indiaâ€™s badminton players starred on the final day of Tokyo Paralympics with Krishna Nagar winning gold and Suhas Yathiraj winning silver in their respective categories to take the countryâ€™s medal haul to 19 on Sunday. Both Indians were involved in thrilling finals that went the distance. There were two fourth place finishes for Indian as well as Tarun Dhillon and the mixed doubles pair of Pramod Bhagat and Palak Kohli went down in the bronze-medal playoffs. The 22-year-old Nagar, seeded second, defeated Hong Kongâ€™s Chu Man in the menâ€™s singles SH6 class final to retain his unbeaten run at the Games and join compatriot Pramod Bhagat in the gold medal winning list. This was Indiaâ€™s fifth gold at the Games.India at Tokyo Paralympics, day 12 live updatesSuhas ended his campaign with silver after going down fighting against top seed Lucas Mazur of France in the menâ€™s singles SL4 class final. Bhagat had claimed Indiaâ€™s first gold in badminton in SL3 class on Saturday.Hereâ€™s a look at some of the best reactions to the Indian shuttlersâ€™ feat.
